column4: can anyone explain me a little part of /etc/network/interfaces ???
how do i deactivate, that stupid clock syncronizing with some ubuntu server????
how do i deactivate, that stupid clock syncronizing with some ubuntu server????
how do i deactivate, that stupid clock syncronizing with some ubuntu server????
right-click ->adjust?
as far as i can see everythings deactivated.... but it still keeps syncronising at the startup
hmm.  i'm not certain if this is actually what you want, but you could do this to disable it: http://ubuntuguide.org/#synchronizingclocktooslow
it might also be that you've enabled UTC in the clock prefs.
disregard my last comment :-) UTC is unix time
what exactly disables "sudo chmod -x /etc/init.d/service_name" ???? In the document you pointed out, it just sais "disable boot-up service"
i'd first see if you've enabled UTC in the clock's prefs.
nope i haven't
topic title: "Synchronizing clock to ntp.ubuntulinux.org"
there is no service_name in my /etc/init.d
see the topic links before that line? http://ubuntuguide.org/#permanentlydisableenableboot-upservices
actually, you might want to ask Seveas.  i'm not completely sure if that will fix your prob.
yep see that one! can't chmod it if there is no such thing as /etc/init.d/service_name
you replace "service_name" with the service you are trying to disable. in this case, it's "ntpdate"
ah i see! :D
you've just learnt the shortcomings of ubguide!
i reckon I'm pretty fast learning! I got ubuntu since three days and never used linux before! :D
cp *.hrf /path/to
